Text: Good quality. Perfect size and quality. Very nice.

I usually buy Indian mixed pickles in a large can but gave the MTR brand a shot and was pleasantly surprised. Very strong, spicy flavor and aftertaste, you can tell there's Asafoetida (sort of a gum resin, used as a digestive aid, popular in Indian pickles and often substituted for onions and garlic in cooking by some as a religious preference). Has a bit of sauce with the vegetables which for me is great. A little can go along way and it's a great condiment for rice and some Indian meals. I've eaten this out of the jar by the spoonful, it's one of those tastes one can aquire and find hard to shake.

This is advertised as a pack of 8. I noticed that it was delivered in a 9-pack with one missing. The quantity delivered is right, just made me do a double take and grin, thinking of a shopkeeper putting individual jars on his shelves when he could have charged me a bit more for the entire pack and saved himself the hassle of opening all those flats to pull one out of each. Sort of an Apu-Simpsons moment.

This molasses has a wonderful flavor (if you like molasses), and it's nice to know it's organic and unsulphured.

(For a nice caffeine-free hot beverage, try a teaspoon or two of this molasses in hot water with additional sweetener, a few drops of vanilla, and creamer of your choice. And you can make your own brown sugar by mixing a teaspoon into a half cup of white sugar.)

The only reason I'm not giving this product five stars is because, as other reviewers have mentioned, the packaging doesn't hold up well in shipping. One of our orders had to be returned because it leaked out of the package and into the courier's truck. Another order leaked but at least stayed within the Amazon box.

Since it's molasses, I'm going to guess that such leaks occur more often in hot summer months. It's still a great product, so winter might be a good time to stock up!
Nice Product

I love Indian food but never have time to go sit at a restaurant. This product helps me have a 'heat 'n eat" meal on hand. Just cook up some rice and put it on top and heat.  The spinach is fairly well spiced but could be too warm for some people's taste.

When I saw the Spicy Thai chips, I knew i had to try them. I love spicy and I love Thai food, so why not? First off, these chips are not super spicy. They actually taste sort of sweet at first, with many degrees of flavor. The spiciness is more of a lingering taste that bites afterwards. I'd say these are definitely a good, unique chip. But if you absolutely hate sweet chips, I'd try a different flavor since these are a little sweet.

I have just started using this supplement after workouts and it has taken me a bit to figure out a taste combo that I can live with. The milk-shake flavor may be a little bit overboard. I would probably like just a normal chocolate flavor. The recommendation is two scoops but I use one and I still feel the taste is quite strong. I mix one scope of this with 2 cups of almond breeze almond milk and sometimes some frozen strawberries - blend it in my blender and it is a great drink. It also provides enough chocolately flavor to cure any possible sweet tooth I might have.

I have tried several types of Murray sugar free cookies and can say that they have all been good and the "Fudge Dipped Mint Cookies" are no exception. These are not quite as good as regular cookies but, being diabetic friendly, are a good alternative.

Recommended!
Very good.. value for money...

I like this product, it is very good, very tasty. It is a versatile product that can be served as is or combined with other foods.

However, I am very disappointed with the way it was shipped. Another item by the same manufacturer was shipped together with this one in one box with not enough packaging material to keep them from jostling about.

NINE of the twelve cans are dented (two of the 4 bean salad cans are dented).

The box had too much free room and one corner was open and had it needed to be shipped further, the contents would have fallen out.
As I said earlier, the product is good but order it by itself so a lazy packer doesn't just shove it into a box with other products with ONLY ONE strip of air pillow packaging material which was totally inadequate.

I still haven't decided if I will order it again. I had to discard one of the cans because both the top and bottom were dented so much a can opener could not be used.
Summary: The product is very good but the packaging was bad

Text: The Folgers Decaf was surprisingly very good!  I normally like a dark robust cup of coffee and have been unable to find a decaf that didn't have an aftertaste or was too bitter.  While this isn't a dark roast, it was still very very good.

I've used MiO since the summer. It's easier to use than the Crystal Light singles (which don't always open easily and can stain your hands), and while I only like only Crystal Light flavor, I've now got two MiO choices--my original favorite, Berry Pomegranate, and as a result of this Amazon Vine selection, Mango Peach.

I always keep a MiO bottle in my bag, to use when water has an "off" taste or isn't cold, and I recommend you do the same. Though the directions indicate you can use as much or little as you want, the recommended amount is a full squirt. For me that's far too much, even for a large glass or typical water bottle, so I suggest you add a little to your water at a time until you determine how much works. If you test it the other way, you may end up making a pitcher rather than a glass, or needing to dilute a water bottle somehow.

Enjoy!
It is impossible to find MBT broth products in the stores anymore and it is simply the best broth for both cooking and light snacking.  Order came on time and as said.
If you like soft, chewy cookies with lots of raisins, this is the cookie for you. My husband and kids love them and I love them because I'm not asked to bake so often with them in the house.
These certainly are fresh and delicious.  However, I buy a 6lb bag of the Black Forest gummy bears and gummy worms mixed for $6 at Costco.

I like Annie's products...just not her purple box on this one:) The only thing that I really don't like about this product is that it needs more sauce. It's pretty light flavored and delicate.  If I don't cook all the macaroni in the box it's better. I may try doctoring the sauce a little to produce more flavor.
Taste of the items are ok. I wont say feel them too good. The preservatives can be reduced a bit. Overall rating is ok for the money.
Good quality. Value for money

I have had the real thing when I was in Hawaii.  Being sugar free this is nowhere near comparable, but does have a pleasant coconut flavor.  It is not as thick as the real thing but serves the purposes for a diabetic like me.

I had ordered this because my mother in law is a pineapple freak.  It got here quickly, so no problem there.  I tasted a piece or two, and am less than impressed.  I will try it in some of her cookies, as she is really excited to try it in them. But as a snacky thing, it doesn't have much taste.

This was actually really nice. It's the color, taste and aroma of green apple, jolly rancher style. I liked the taste and the color was candy color green perfect.

The only thing I would do differently is use one packet to one quart of water. At two quarts the power of the apple taste was really muted. With ice it's more noticeable, but with a 1 to 1 ratio it was a nice little punch of apple and on ice, I thought it was perfect as a drink.

So for me it loses a star if you make it according to directions. Other than that, if you like green apple candy, you'll love this.

4 stars.
The butter flavored season salt taste just like the salt at the movie theatre. And so much better than that little store bought flavors. Awesome!

These do really taste great without having to toast them if you want a healthy snack any time of day. I got them because they were identified as vegan. Two disappointments regarding these:

1. The packaging indicates that the product is made in a facility that processes milk, tree nuts, etc. So I'm not sure they should be classifying the product as vegan if there are possibly traces of milk in the product. But it won't stop me from finishing what I've bought.

2. When you get the 12 pack, it does have a note suggesting that they be stored in the freezer to maintain freshness and then just pop them in a standard toaster when you want one. I will have to wait a week or so to do this with those I've not eaten as I had just gone shopping the day before getting the product and my freezer was full.

Hope this information is helpful to others.

These pepper flakes have a rich, slightly acidic flavor and not a lot of heat.  They have a slightly moist consistency -- not sure if that will affect shelf-life.  Shipping was fast, but overly expensive.
My picky eater cat is getting older and rejects plenty of other cat foods. She loves this one and has less shedding because of the ingredients in this food.
Summary: The only cat food my cat eats and loves

Text:
My only quibble with this product is a poor nutiritional label that is unclear about the carb count. When you're doing a low carb diet, you can't risk not understanding the nutritional information on the package.

As far as taste goes, these are good. It's a really good low carb snack.
Summary: Nice product for low carb snacking

Text: Nice product. Good quality
Good
Got a good deal on them. Got them fast. I eat a bowl everyday in the morning. keeps me healthy.
Good

I'd previously found a canister of this at a local discount store and liked it enough to seek it out again at Amazon.  I can't say I'd be able to identify the flavor as either pomegranate or cherry, but it's fruity and pleasant.  I've switched to drinking rooibos in the evenings instead of tea with caffeine and this is now one of my staple flavors.

Like all sugar-free products, this one has that sugar-free aftertaste. However, if you like Crystal Light, this one is a good flavor!  I like mojitos and thought the flavor of this was pretty spot-on.  It is very sweet, so I add a squeeze or wedge of lime since I don't have much of a sweet tooth.  With the lime added, I find this refreshing and tasty and definitely worth drinking!
Summary: If you like Crystal Light, this is a good one.

Text: Taste is a bit bitter like most artificially flavored drinks.  But it does wake you up with a quick burst of energy similar to coffee.
Nice It is just a Superb Product

Our last cat spent his last few years with hardly any teeth (although he was 21) and thus could only eat wet canned food. So, when we adopted a new one we decided to take better care of his teeth from the start.  We feed him feline greenies daily as a treat and give him one of these chews a few times a week.  I suppose we could also brush his teeth but to me that seems like overkill (he is a cat after all).  Anyway, he absolutely loves these chews. He bats them around all the while biting them and after a short while the chew breaks apart and he wolfs it down with delight.  I cannot give this product 5 stars only because I cannot say what long term effect it is having on his teeth because he's only 2 so has good health all around.  I wasn't sure if he would like these treats as the common complaint in the other reviews seems to be that some cats just wont touch them.  However, since the treat is pretty similar to a wine cork I would suggest you see first if your cat will play with one (our cat loves batting corks all over the house).  I have a strong feeling if your cat likes to play (with corks especially) he or she will love these chews

IBC Sugar Free Root Beer Barrels are very good tasting hard candies. These are sweetended with sucralose (Splenda), and taste very close to regular root beer barrel candy.

You do have to be aware that a serving size of 2 pieces still have 40 calories, but the good news for us diabetis is that they have 0 net carbs.

Recommended!
Summary: Good Tasting Sugar Free Candy - Recommended

Text: the ferals arent fussy but my house cat is sometimes tho at 22 lb you wouldn't think so. everyone is eating so I figure thats a good sign with cats who can be arrogant even when homeless.
Summary: the cats like it so far

Text: The silicone top on the one I received was misshapen from being loose in the box. When you shut it, it did not close evenly, leaving gaps on either side. I ordered a second one before sending the first one back. The second one arrived anchored in its box properly and the top closed evenly. I have gotten this as a gift for a family member, a chef, who would have been driven to distraction by the first one. The little spoon is fairly useless but the little salt saver works nicely and keeps spatters from cooking out of the salt. Cute and handy.
There should be free delivery on 150 plus product but else the product was very good

I guess there are vitamins in there, but it seems to me that this is candy.  I love the flavor and the chewy little honey nub inside.  However, I am not sure I get an energy boost anymore than I would with a regular piece of candy.
They were good, however I now know not to order them in the summer. The candy had melted and was hard to get out of wrapper but taste was GREAT!! Waiting for cool weather to order more.

Starting with the blender half full of water.
I make 3 to 4 servings of each, use it in 3 days or less.
Add water, Hemp milk or Almond milk
Hemp protein power
Hemp seed nut
Chia seed powder (this will gel if you let it sit)
Acai
Lucuma
Gelatinized Maca
Dulse flakes
Camu Camu
Cacao (strong tasting, you will know if you use too much)
Frozen Blueberries or cherries (about a cup)
Navitas Coconut Palm Sugar (or YACON to taste)
Also I add some goldenseal root.(Today, goldenseal is marketed as a tonic to aid digestion, sooth upset stomach, and as an antibacterial agent. It is considered a natural antibiotic and is most often combined with echinacea in preparations designed to strengthen the immune system. However, only one study found that goldenseal might help boost white blood cells (a measure of the infection fighting ability of the immune system), and it wasn't well designed.

Mix the Hemp nut, Dulse flakes and fruit first; on high, till it makes a "milk".
Then the rest of each item, you want in it
If it gets too thick. Add some more water.
You can add yogurt, take the seaweed flakes out if you like. it will taste good if you work on it.
Check the website navitasnaturals. For more recipes, and info.
Summary: In the raw, smoothie maker: 4 star first review. More recipes, and info.

Text:
I recently adopted a kitten just under a year old. At first we thought there was something wrong with her, she wouldn't do normal crazy kitten things. After reading about cat nutrition, I discovered what I had fed to my cats as a kid was completely backwards, as is most 'cat food' even today. I read about BFF and decided to let her try some. Now my cat doesn't rest all day, but is playful and as crazy as a kitten should be. Also of note, there is much more urine in her litter box each day, which is a good sign of how much water is in the food. She's also volunteering her presence more now, not just when she is hungry. I had to take a star off, not because of the product, but since Amazon doesn't let me order more than 2 packs per flavor. I'd give it 6 stars if I could 'subscribe' as you can with other types of food on Amazon.

Also, I would recommend the 3oz cans if you have only one cat. You will have to feed him/her more throughout the day, but it can dry out if they don't finish it, which defeats some of the purpose besides being unappetizing to the cat.
Price dropped by $5 in matter of 2 days.  Item didn't even arrive but Amazon refused to price match.  Disappointed with policy but tea itself is good.

Well, we ordered the beef pockets and got chicken instead. Fortunately my dog will eat either kind so I wasn't too upset. Order arrived very quickly. These pill pockets are the best if you have dogs who don't take pills well. My dog thinks she is getting a treat every morning.

Makes an excellent cup of coffee. The vanilla flavor is not too overwhelming as to detract from the overall taste of a really good cup of coffee. Also, a little goes a long way. This is fine grind (no pun intended)and it doesn't take much coffee to make a 10 cup pot. Enjoy!Mr. Coffee CGX23 12-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker, Black
Need to mention origin of country. We need made in India only.

I bought this pack a couple of weeks ago and my daughter seems to enjoy all the fruit flavors.  Yes the bananas are a little different color but they seem to be ok and she likes them just the same as the other two flavors.  Target near me offers them in this size for $.53 a jar but only in two of the fruit flavors so for a slight more variety it is worth the price and it is all natural too!  I would recommend this product to other moms!

This tea comes in individual packets. It's kind of crystalized, not exactly powdered, but it dissolves quickly and easily. It has a very strong ginger bite to it to please those of you that are disappointed with the weak ginger taste of ginger ale and some ginger beers. I love ginger and enjoyed this tea immensely. It was flavorful without adding sweetener or lemon.
Summary: Instand tea with a gingery bite

Text: Best quality

I purchased this "gift pack" for my cousin as a Christmas gift. He loves hot sauces and I thought this would be the perfect "usable" gift. While he was very happy with the sauces (before even tasting them), I was disappointed at the fact that this item was listed as a "gift pack." When I think of a "gift pack" I think of something that is nicely boxed or packaged. What I received was a shipping box with 6 bottles of hot sauce, each individually wrapped in packing paper to avoid damage during shipping. They're fine - don't get me wrong - but not very presentable as a "gift."
Good product

To everyone worried about not getting a full cup to run through your machine with these k-cups, here's the trick.  Put it in your machine, close the lid, open the lid, turn 90 degrees, close the lid and repeat two more times.  You should have closed the lid on the k-cup four times by now.  Next step is to hit the brew button.  The problem is the needle is too small to run the chocolate through.  With the extra three holes it all flows out very quick and turns out good.  Would have given them five stars if it was able to run through the needle like it is supposed to.  Could have been a little thicker overall, but not bad.
delivery was within the given date which is good and football looks very awesome and strong but have to wait and watch the quality.

I like the Gevalia better than the Starbucks Caffe Verona my husband first bought me. The Starbucks is way too strong and bitter, in my opinion. However, I'm a "foo-foo" coffee lover, the more fancy the flavor the better. I like the Swiss Hazelnut as a basic coffee; although it's even a bit on the strong side, but not bad. I add the latte creamer or cappacino creamer to it...using a BIG cup.

I really like this peppered bacon salt on popcorn and it's great in tomato juice.  It's probably great for alot of other drinks and dishes that I will eventually try.  As a person who loves bacon but rarely eats it, this offers the flavor without the fat.

there are many negative reviews about connectivity and i was also doubtfull about its connectivity but xiaomi has done a good job after giving updates to the Tv and we don't have to reconnect it again and again,picture quality is best in this price range,one have to choose the mode which they like according to their eye adjustments and sound also has many modes which you can prefer according to your need.If one has to cast something from mobile and don't have a wifi connection but have a xiao...

Oatmeal raisin cookies are my favorite type of cookie. My grandma makes the best oatmeal raisin cookies and a lady at church makes the second best. However, I'm always willing to try someone else's oatmeal raisin cookies. Recently, Quaker started selling these SOFT-BAKED OATMEAL COOKIE WITH RAISINS. The cookies themselves aren't too bad. They're better than the usual store-bought oatmeal cookie. They're soft and chewy with a slightly sweet aftertaste. However, there's nothing that really distinguishes them either. There are 6 cookies in a box. They are good cookies that make a nice after lunch dessert or an in between snack.

As I said in the title, the best part of this hair oil is the soft hair I get after using it.  You only need a little -- less than a pea-sized drop (any more than that will make my hair look and feel dirty and oily).  I love how the oil immediately soaks into my hair.  As long as I don't use too much, this hair oil is great.
Summary: Makes my hair feel so soft!

Text: Nice product...But1) no bulb provided with package so it was tough to find E27 buld.2) hold kn top is not clean causing issue to tighten wire.
Nice
Used these salts to treat my steak before cooking and it was worth the wait, the flavor came through to the very last bite.
I ordered this coffee because we were having guests for a week from out of town.  I knew they liked French Roast coffee.  Well it was a total success.  Great coffee and conversations.  Thanks.
Nice

After shopping around for some K-cups that were affordable, I decided to give Donut House a try.  We don't like the heavier French roast types or flavored coffees, so this brand and type are a good one for us. We like a light  to medium roast coffee.
Good

I am not a huge fan of raisins but the Quaker brand has always been one I loved. I did try the cookie and it was so soft and melted in my mouth . Had a great and healthy taste of whole grains and overall is a good Cookie.
Summary: Soft baked Quaker cookie ( influenster sample)

Text: This gift is a wonderful accompaniment to any kitchen, especially for those who are health conscious and want to serve natural and organic foods at home.  The Braggs Liquid aminos is an excellent alternative to soy sauce (without all the extra salt) and have used it twice for the base of delicious marinades on seafood, along with garlic and ginger.  The Braggs organic seasoning is very tasty on mixed vegetables to kick them up a notch, or sprinkled on potatoes.  Just watch out with how much you are using if you have high blood pressure or are watching your sodium intake.  The quinoa was very fresh and nutty tasting, and I liked the fact that it is pre-washed, saving an arduous step in cooking quinoa.  Makes it a very easy and healthy side dish to include with any main dish.
Summary: Perfect gift for the natural & health minded cook

Text: I picked Sahale cashews with pomegranate at a Starbuck's after coming from the gym. They are so tasty, not too sweet but sweet enough. I was delighted to be able to order them on Amazon. They are a bit pricey, but come out cheaper when you buy them in bulk vs. buying single packets in local stores. I will buy them again.

I received a container of this snack mix as a gift. My husband loved it so much that I placed a subscription so he could receive a new container periodically. He was delighted until we learned that they were out of stock for the second delivery!

Still, we're looking forward to the next delivery.

A lot of the other "Good" cat food companies sold out to others that ended up producing lower quality cat food resulting in many cat deaths. I hope Wellness tells pet stores before hand so the cat owner knows - I check the website monthly.

One of my cats looks like he hates this stuff, but when it runs out and I can not get to the store soon he cries for it even though he gets to share a can or two of soft cat food with his pals everday.

I wish they would take the rice out of the Wellness blue bag cat food - makes me wonder if these people know what they are doing.

Meow, hiss, hiss, purr!
Summary: Hope they don't sell out like all the others.

Text:
Not sure whether it's truly wild or not, but it's definitely one of the better tasting canned salmon products I've had.

A bit on the salty side, the wholesome chunks of salmon meat come with both skin and some bones.
Very fast delivery by flipkart...Good packing....About Product..Very good design..All parts locking unlocking very smoothly..Very easy to use.Powerful Motor. Nice gift for ladies..
Summary: Good product and Very fast delivery of flipkart.. :D

Text: All my life, I'd heard of Mallomars, but had never seen or tried them. These are reasonably tasty, with a darker chocolate coating. My only real problem was on fully half of them, the marshmallow separated from the cookie base. I doubt if I'll buy these again. There's better chocolate marshmallow cookies out there, even Walmart's are better.
Good
Very comfortable for baby

I wanted to make sure that I gave my little one products that had little to no fillers and that definitely had no grain. I grabbed this at a local pet store and am very happy that I did because my cat loves it. When I tried giving him the chicken formula, he decided that he rather go hungry than eat it but this flavor, he gobbled right up. I do have to mash it down a bit and mix in some water so that it has a gravy-like consistency that is more appetizing. Once he's done, he just lays there contently licking his chops. It makes me feel great knowing that I'm giving him something that is a healthier alternative to some other brands.

ETA: I forgot to add in that the reason for the 4 star review is because of the consistency. I wish it had some type of gravy with it to entice my cat to eat it without me having to fiddle around with it.
These are alot cheaper than in a retail store, stinky but the dogs love them and it takes them along time to finish them off, I means weeks.

I ordered the 6 pack on a 6 month subscription. The price is about 50 cents cheaper per stick then the local grocery store. I occasionally get irritation from deodorant so chose this one with Aloe. It seems to help with the irritation. The scent is nice and mild, not overwhelming. I was in a situation where I wasn't able to shower for 24 hours and the deodorant never quit. I don't plan on that happening again but am happy to know if it does I wont stink lol. If this is your normal brand try the Subscribe and Save and see if its a savings for you.

**UPDATE**
Amazon raised the price of the deodorant and is not longer competitive with local stores. Due to this fact I am no longer on subscription with this product. It's still a great product but no longer at a great price if you can get it locally.
This is my least favorite flavor, I find it bland.  But these small bags are great for kids lunches, and a nice alternative to fattening chips.  The chips have a great texture for not being fried.
Like this coffee occasionally, bit bold a coffee blend for regular drinking.  Can't fault the blend for this, it's more a personal taste.

My favorite Herbal Tea.  It tastes kinda like Big Red chewing gum, but in a delicious way.  About a dollar cheaper a box then if I buy it locally since only the heath food stores carry it around here.
This coffee is very good. A little strong for my taste but I mix it 1/2 & 1/2 with regular coffee.
I like this
Good

This coffee tastes amazing, and with my new Keurig machine, it only takes about 45 seconds to brew. When I'm on the go, I usually brew two of these K-cups and add milk to my travel mug. Still tastes great! I would recommend it to any avid coffee drinker.
Good
My baby loves this formula. I love it too except for the messy and inconvenient pouch it comes packaged in. Can we please go back to the old tin?
Probably our favorite of all the Kind bars we have tried.  My daughter does not eat a lot in the morning but she will eat these.  Thank you Kind Bars!

Although this tea tastes great, it's just an instant tea mix that get completely dissolved (k-cup gets empty). I still really like it, and drink it, just not that often. The taste is reminiscent of pumpkin spice tea. It's rather sweet tasting. It may have artificial sweeteners in it (I'm not sure, but I think other reviewers mentioned it).
Summary: Great taste, but it's not a real tea

Text: Ok...Too small

I got the Hazelnut and the Walnut butters.

They are VERY delicious!! The walnut butter is very dense - not really spreadable, but that really doesnt matter to me. I got these nut butters becuz i am vegetarian, and eating nuts themselves gives me awful pains. The butters are perfect for me to eat, even if it is just by the small spoonfull!

You can tell these are high quality butters. I didnt give 5 stars becuz there are no directions about how to keep, or how long they last. I have emailed the company to see if they need to go in the fridge. I dont like my natural peanut butter that way - but i know sometimes you just have to, to make it last.

I will order from this company again.
Good one
Good

Hi, does this supplement make you super thirsty? I wanted to check because I have been feeling very thirsty especially in the late evening. It has coincided with me taking this supplement. But I have heard that excessive thirst is also symptom of diabetes. Is it documented anywhere that magnesium can result in thirst? If anyone can share this info, it would be greatly appreciated.

As for the product, I just started it. The taste is citrusy. I have had no side effects other than thirst. But I don't know how much is psychological I have already been feeling more energy. I will update if I continue this for a longer time hopefully.

Dogs seem to like them ok.  They are easy enough to give and are not all that messy.  They are Greyhounds, so a larger Breed and these actually seemed to be a find size for them.  Hard to say if they have a good line to good Dental Health. Brushing your Dog's teeth is a good road to go for good dental hygene. They do have a bit of a stronger smell than some of the Dental Chew treats I have dealt with and a positive is that they don't contain gluten.

Last fall I visited Quebec City and fell in love with maple syrup.  Now I'm back home and would like to do some baking, only problem is finding good and affordable maple sugar.  I found it with Coombs.  No wonder, I already use the syrup they produce.  This maple sugar is delicious and wonderful in baking.  Loved it.

So my Mom often buys bags of kitty treats for her "grandkitten"... and I find it so hilarious that if it isnt the Temptations treats in the yellow bag, he will NOT touch them. We can mix different brands together in a pile, and he will pull the Temptations treats out with his paw and leave the others. Its unreal. Either they just hit the jackpot with the perfect cat-seducing ingredients, or they have some sort of addictive substance in them.... who knows! :) I only give them 4 stars because they are not the "healthiest" treat for a cat, but honestly... he just loves them so much I cant say no.
Summary: The only treats my cat will eat

Text: Nic

Love those Belly Flops!  Unfortunately, one of my last 2 bags was 40-50% Cafe Latte.  Not a very good mix; and certainly not appreciated by my kids or wife (who doesn't drink coffee).  The 2nd bag had a better variety and my kids and their friends wolfed them down.  You roll the dice, you take your chances...

Have purchased Two Leaves and a Bud tea many times over the years and have to say that the peppermint is, by far, my favorite. The mint is clean and refreshing and the tea is high quality. The tea bags are made of a fine mesh and the leaves are large cut and release very little dust that can ruin the end of a cup. I prefer to drink my tea after steeping for 2-3 minutes (don't like it overly strong myself) and find I can usually get a decent second cup from 1 tea bag. It is one of my favorite peppermint teas though I have knocked off one star for the high price and the fact that the mesh tea bags occasionally rip if you're not careful when pulling the tag off.

I rate this product four nuggets of goodness. Minus one nugget for not containing any nuts despite the name which strongly suggests the product contains nuts. However, that doesn't stop my wife from eating copious amounts of this breakfast cereal. It's by far her favorite, and we go through an absolute ton of it each year. I think it's tasty. Still wish it had some nuts in it.
Haltex candies are amazing tasteful even though they are sugar free.  They have a distinct taste but are a little on the expensive side.

I saw a negative review for these candies and thought it was far too harsh
now i have never tasted fresh mangosteen so I cannot say wether this candy taste like it or not BUT as a candy in general it is not bad and certainly not disgusting.
the taste is very unique, sweet at first and bitter at end, its pleasant. I was skeptical to try them at first, but i am glad i did, they are like nothing i have tasted before, come in the most adorable heart shape, have a very unique chewy texture and best of all is that they all come individualy wraped :D
the taste is not very kid oriented and more for a mature sweet tooth. and it gives off a very fun sour scent
this product is great ... talking about them is really making me want one so I shall go treat myself right now.

also buyer beware: they are pricy and should only be eaten in special occasions ^^
Very nice product
Excellent so nice

These cheese curls taste much better that biscuit company variety, being a much more enjoyable, cheesier experience.  They are preservative, guilt free, low in saturated fat, and a rather nice expiration period, so you don't have to worry much about gorging on them before they expire.

This chocolate is only 54% cocoa solids. Given that many of the better bittersweet or dark chocolates have 65-80% cocoa solids, that gives a lot of room for other ingredients, which in this case is sugar.  Although being organic, you get the high falutin sounding "evaporated cane juice", which is, of course, sugar.  Although the chocolate flavor is good, this bar is on the sweet side.  So if you are looking for something stronger or with a sharper edge, you should avoid this one.  However, if you have a sweet tooth, and want a good fruity chocolate flavor, this chocolate would be to your liking.

I never drink this tea alone. I always steep it with another tea, such as Oolong or Jasmine because the taste isn't the best. I use honey and sugar to sweeten and down the hatch it goes! Expect some, um, gastrointestinal responses the next day. Sometimes I feel a bit of cramping and sometimes I don't. Sometimes it will take most of the next day for it to 'work'...and sometimes it won't!!

My family has two cats who are just over a year old. We usually feed them dry food, but give them the canned stuff once in a while for a treat. Our large sized male cat LOVES Petite Cuisine, and gobbles it up. Our dainty little female though, refuses table scraps and won't touch any wet food, including Petite Cuisine. My kids helped me to take notes on this food as we offered it to both cats. The same thing happened with every flavor- little cat A sniffed it and walked away, while big fat cat B ate it up as fast as he could! I guess it's all a matter of preference.

I feel good about the fact that this stuff is natural and looks like food. it is not full of fillers, and it has everything a cat requires for a healthy diet. The cans are the right size for a single serving for an average to big cat, so there's no messing around with storing half empty cans of fragrant catfood in the fridge.

I can taste artificial sweeteners from across the street. Hate the stuff. In a restaurant I sent a Coke back three times because they kept bringing me Diet, assuring me it was the real thing. After the third time I suggested they check their hoses. Sure enough, they were switched. Hate the stuff. One sip and my mouth says, "Yuk!" for hours. This doesn't even get into the fact that aspertame isn't fit for human consumption.

Enter Xylitol. I bought a box of packets to use at the office where I drink coffee. I find I need two Xylitol packs to replace one sugar. No matter. It tastes fine. I detect no aftertaste. And it's actually good for my teeth and blood sugar level. This is something I can like!

My only complaint was the shipping packaging. The box of packets was stuffed into an envelope which, of course, arrived flattened. Packets were all over the inside. I reformed the box and reloaded it. No biggie, but putting a rectangular cardboard box in an envelope isn't the best idea.
Summary: Most of the sweet, none of the yuk

Text: This is a great concept, period.  Small container of concentrated flavor that you can add to your drink until you get the flavor profile you want.  Infinite possibilities!  I also like this particular flavor a lot as it doesn't seem "fakey".

These are pretty good.  They pass the wife and son test.  They have a slight powdered egg flavor, like the Egg Beaters in the carton.  I add a little milk while mixing, which makes them come out fluffy.  A good item to have in your 'survival' food bin.  They'll keep a long time without refrigeration.  I gave them a 4 only because of the slight powdered taste, but if I'm sitting in a field, they'd taste pretty good.
Good
Nice product

I have been buying bars from KIND for a few months, and I decided to see how they do shipped from Amazon rather than buying from the store. I love the Dark Chocolate, Nuts, and Sea Salt variety as well as many of the others. The bars buy themselves are worth 5 stars for taste and healthy diet considerations. While they have a high ratio of fat, the fat from nuts is beneficial in reasonable amounts.

So if everything is so great, you might be wondering why I only gave them 4 stars. Unfortunately, the product is somewhat degraded in the delivery process. I'm not sure what time the Post Office left them in my mailbox, but the Texas sun was not kind (no pun intended) to them while they waited for me to get home and retrieve them. The dark chocolate wound up melting to an extent. Even after waiting for it to solidify the next day, the melted chocolate that adhered to the wrapper went everywhere when I opened the bars. It did not affect the taste any, but this is not a problem that I encounter when I buy them in the store and bring them straight home. This is not an issue for the non-chocolate varieties, but I cannot recommend buying any of the bars from KIND in the summer.
Summary: Great Product - Just Not As Great Shipped In The Summer

Tonics do not give immediate results but work gradually over time.

My two maltese really like these treats. I like the Extra Fresh flavor much better. Both of my dogs have really bad dental issues- I brush them every day but I also give them a dental bone every day. The Nutri Dents have gone in their regular rotation. My dogs are pretty small- Romeo is about 11 pounds and Juliet is roughly 9 pounds. They used to be given these mini ones, but because they are pretty aggressive chewers- I now give them the medium version after some trial and error, as these mini ones were devoured too quickly. These treats aren't super soft- but they are relatively soft when compared to other, harder dental treats we have tried. These have a really similar texture to the Greenies brand, but we like these ones much better than the Greenies. These treats smell pretty gross to me, but my pups love them. I like the smell of the Extra Fresh ones- they really smell like parsley and eucalyptus oil, which both can be found on the ingredient list of that flavor. I like that these are gluten free. I like that they have added vitamins and omegas. These ones are okay nutritionally for a treat, and the chewing action is always a good thing, but I like that the other flavor has actual ingredients that are good for dental health. Most importantly, my dogs love the taste of both of the treats. I buy these ones rarely, as I much prefer the other flavor, but these are still good treats. The only negatives I have are that these are really pricey, and they are devoured quite quickly, even by my dogs who are 12 years old and missing nearly half of their teeth. They are still much better than many other treat brands out there and I do recommend them.
Summary: Good, but try the Extra Fresh flavor

This tea smells and tastes like tea that has a lemon slice put into it. The pyramidal design lets the leaves expand and float freely inside the bag, allowing for more of the tea flavor to diffuse. The downside is that the bag is made of nylon or some kind of plastic mesh, making it non-biodegradable. The pyramids are also just boxed together, not individually sealed for freshness.

The black tea taste does seem weaker than the traditional flat Lipton tea bags. Maybe I've had the box open for too long (but it's well before the Best Before date of 10/24/11), or it's being masked by the lemon juice concentrate and marigold petals. For iced tea (with honey), however, I can't really complain about the taste. If you don't have real lemons around, this is a good alternative.

Curiously, modified corn starch is listed as an ingredient. I don't know what this additive does for tea and it's the first tea product I've seen it in.

One bag 110mg of flavonoid antioxidants and 55mg of caffeine.
Summary: Good tea with real lemon smell and taste

I have three (3) cats that use to all eat Purina One brand cat food. After reading up on the topic extensively I have found out that most cat foods use grain fillers as primary ingredients and that cats do not normally eat that type of product. These grain fillers can have negative effects on cats such as obesity, diabetes, allergies (much like gluten allergies in humans) and other issues that can significantly shorten a cat's life or make for very often and expensive vet visits. I decided to switch to EVO Turkey & Chicken after reviewing all the different brands of all-natural cat foods. This diet is essentially like the Paleo-diet for humans in that the main ingredients are meat.
So far my cats have been on this diet for about three (3) months and I have noticed increased energy, brighter eyes and coats, and more playfulness. I have even got away from giving traditional treats in favor of wet grain-free food. My cats have loved it as a treat a few times a week and it gives them additional nutrients that some experts say dry food is lacking in.
The only bad thing about this food is that it is kinda crubly and does end up getting on the floor when the cats eat it. Just make sure to clean this residue and crums up so you do not get ants or other bugs.
Summary: Very good cat food just makes for a lot of crumbs

Text: Nice

After listening to the commercials I bit and bought the 5 Hour Energy drink. I tried it out just last week. Believe me, this is powerful stuff. It's not just the caffeine that has an effect on you. There are other ingredients that also alter the chemistry of the brain.

We've mentioned caffeine. Big deal. You drink a cup of coffee and you'll get the equivalent amount, which is about 100 mg. Compared to a lot of energy drinks that's relatively mild. 5 Hour Energy makes a decaffeinated energy drink too, so we have to assume that the real effects don't rely on the caffeine. And it's about time. All caffeine really does is substitute one state of poor concentration (sleepy) with another (jittery). Other ingredients help to increase concentration and some even act as mood stabilizers. Still others are nutrients and vitamins.

But that's theory. The real world effects are another story. I tried 5 Hour Energy after a sleepless night. After taking just one shot, which is really the maximum recommended dose, I felt awake, alert and ready to face the day. BUT as the day went on there were other effects. I noticed that my concentration was improved using this drug even more so than with Adderall. (So if you're ADD like me, you could possibly self-medicate with 5 Hour Energy. Just make sure none of this gets out to Big Pharma.)

Unfortunately it had some unwelcome effects. I felt as if there was a dynamo spinning constantly in my head. My thoughts started to race. I was worried, briefly, but convinced myself that the sensation would go away, and it did after just 15-30 minutes.

I now think that 1/2 to 2/3 of a bottle may be the best dose for me. I'm not a fan of inebriation, but I could clearly identify a brief "high" and a slow letdown period that has surely gotten plenty of twentysomethings addicted to this drug.

My advice? Use it wisely. Don't underestimate it because it's small. Whatever you do, don't drink more than one in a 3 hour period or two in a day - so says the label, probably for good reason. And get your sleep if you can. Energy drinks aren't an excuse to not sleep.

And again, let me be clear. This is a drug!
Summary: Has a powerful effect on the brain.

I received the under cabinet K-Cup holder promptly. The packaging was a simple plastic bag, but it included everything need from instructions to alcohol cleaning pads and screws.

Install was simple. Clean the underside of the cabinet with the alcohol wipes and allow to dry. Peal back the double sided tape already attached to the holder. Press it up and into the underside of the cabinet. Hold for 60 seconds. Screw in the supplied screws.

My only complaint was that my item was slightly bent/malformed. I fixed this with some light taps of a hammer and I squared everything up.

Overall, I am very happy with this product and it saves counter space.

I have been drinking fine tea for a few years now. I have a couple of favorite Assams that I have enjoyed for some time. Both are graded TGFOP and both are superb: filled with body, complex flavor, malty. But over the years I have become concerned about pesticides used in foods. I have chosen to use as many organic food products as I reasonably can. I recently tried this Stash Premium Organic Assam Tea.

This is a very good tea. The pouch is filled with quality loose leaf product. My uneducated guess would be an approximate grade of FOP or perhaps TGFOP.

The taste is basic, unadorned Assam. Malty and full of body. It is not as complex as teas from the finest plantations. By complex, think of colors. This tea flavor has maybe one or two colors, where a complex tea from a fine plantation might have 3, 4, or more flavors you can distinctly identify.

Still, at a fair price and with an organic grade, this will be a regular choice at my house in the future.

I would prefer to see an organic tea packaged in a non-plastic pouch though.
Summary: High quality, organic!, a little flat

Text: I got one K-Cup of Wolfgang Puck's Colombian Reserve dark roast as part of a variety 35-pack that I bought here on Amazon. Since I'd always assumed that I preferred the less-burnt flavor of a light or medium roast, I was pleasantly surprised that I enjoyed the way this coffee sat on my tongue. It is sweet, full, and gently bitter. I brewed it in a 9.25 oz. cup in an effort to dilute it a little, but I may be gutsy enough to try a 7.25 oz. cup the next time around.
Summary: Great, considering I usually prefer a light/medium roast

Only thing I wish was that they were a bit larger of sorts. Just two hours after eating them I definitely had to break into my lunch stash or find another snack, though ignoring that they were all around good, definitely get some.

I purchased this product on Amazon.com based on some of the positive reviews. It was well worth it! I like pumpkin spiced coffees or lattes in the fall, but don't like paying the coffeehouse prices. And frankly, I was tired of the inconsistent flavoring added to my orders -- some would be bitterly spicy or have little pumpkin flavor at all.

The Amoretti Premium Syrup solved those problems. By following the instructions for adding to coffee *exactly as written on the bottle*, my coffee beverages taste great. [This was noted in several of the reviews here, which was very helpful.)

This is a quality syrup, and the free pump that comes with it is very convenient.

I wonder if the other reviewer has gotten old tea; that would cause it to lose flavor. While this is certainly not what anyone would consider a "quality" tea, and it doesn't have, as the other reviewer mentions, a traditional Russian tea flavor, if you want a strong black loose tea at a really good price this is worth it. I usually drink it when I need that caffeine pick-me-up, not when I want a flavorful tea experience. For that go green.

Text:
Traverse Bay dried cherries are absolutely fabulous. Bought them for my Dad to help with his gout: within a week or so he was out of the slipper and back in normal shoes. Big Pharma gout meds can make the gout worse while your body deals with the sharp uric crystals freed by the meds. If you want or need the meds, take them, but do try cherries also! Any form, apparently, is helpful: fresh, dried, even the nasty red dyed ones in jars; cherry juice. The cherries have eased my daughter's achey joints due to Lyme.
HOWever, do keep an eye on the price!! They went from $23 to $28 to $43 to $20 in the space of days. I fnally shelled out the $43 cos my family were out, and I figured that the supplies were seasonally low. Plus, Amazon exhorted me to "BUY NOW! Only 6 boxes left in stock". So I did and in less than 2 days they went from $43 to TWENTY DOLLARS. Must say I was miffed. I'd have cancelled the unshipped order but was away from 'net for a crucial day.....
Some folks have said the odd batch can taste oily or perhaps stale. We have yet to notice that, and we've been buying them repeatedly since Sept. In 7 boxes (including the 2 lb double bags when the box was gone for a few weeks), we've not found a bum supply.
Great eaten as they arrive; fantastic in cereal or yoghurt; and if you have arthritis due to age or Lyme; if you have gout; do give them a try.
Summary: Keep an eye on the price!

Text: My husband and I really like this cocoa.  I add extra milk to my cup for a creamier flavor, but the convenience cannot be beat.

No complaints about this food.  Our breeder recommended it for our 8 wk old Frenchie and this food seemed good in that Luna ate most of it and her stool was pretty firm.  Gas was not a real problem.  We switched to Blue Buffalo, which has firmed up her stool a bit more (which I prefer), but no complaints about this food.  I just found one that's better for us.

Saw these locally on an end of the aisle display and impulsively threw a box into the cart. We often eat packs of cheese crackers for lunch; this is a brand I hadn't tried before.

The light colored crackers contain a generous amount of "cheese". They are very crunchy and flavorful, so much so that when finished I wanted to open another pack but resisted.

Some things to consider:
The crackers are filled with "cheddar cheese flavored filling."
One package is 210 calories, 100 of which are from fat.
The sodium content is 370mg

By comparison, a package of Lance cheese crackers has 190 calories and 270mg of sodium.
A package of Ritz cracker sandwiches has 200 calories and 440 mg of sodium.

I wouldn't eat the Munchies on a daily basis, but for an occasional snack or lunch they are quite tasty.

In the past couple years I have eaten and reviewed several kinds and styles of chips,  from the best I've ever had to big disappointments.  If you have eaten the LantChips varieties, there is no way that they are not the best as a group; the Kettle chips are rightly salted and I was so irritated by some Pringles products. This is the first treat I've gotten that says it is for both cats and dogs, so I was a little skeptical at first that my cat, Lily, would like it. She's 15 years old and has become very finicky about what she eats. She now turns up her nose at our Purina dry food, which used to be her favorite. I've been feeding her cans of salmon and gravy (Fancy Feast) but even with that she leaves a lot of leftover salmon pieces in the bowl (!)

Discouraged, I had nothing to lose and decided to give her half of a Raw Boost treat to see if she'd like it. The box says you should give your cat only one or 2 treats per 20lbs of the cat's weight. Well, my Lily is a tiny cat and weighs only 5 lbs or so, so imagine my dilemma. Taking the treat out of the package, I was amused at how much the treat resembles a peanut butter cookie. It's soft, however, and easy to tear in half. It feels crumby like a cookie, however, so I decided to break it down into little "crumbs" for Lily to eat. She has problems with digestion and throws up more than the typical cat, so I'm always careful to chop up her food into small, bite-sized pieces.

Imagine my relief that Lily loves it! She licked her dish clean and begged for more. I'm going to make a note to buy more.
Summary: My Finicky, Older Cat Licks the Bowl Clean When I Give Her This

Text: Delicious free sample arrived with another order I placed on Amazon. I got the dark chocolate sea salt. At first I cringed at the idea of sea salt and chocolate...but it's wonderful and complimentary. I did not expect the pronouncement of the sea salt flavor to be as bold as it was, and to go so well with the dark semi-sweet goodness of the chocolate laced nut variety. I will be ordering these in bulk. Been on a gluten free kick lately after reading up on the horrors of gluten on blood sugar. You'll have to do your own research, but it's shocking, thinking you've been eating healthy wheat, only to realize that for some wheat can be the cause to many progressing health problems. Again, subjective information. Do your own reading. But these are not modified, are gluten free, and I can pronounce and understand everything on the label. Nothing hydrolized or masked.

Note that here on Amazon you can purchase bounty bars in boxes with varying numbers of bars inside, so it is worth your while to crunch the numbers and think about what package offers the best value for you. At the same time, it may not be entirely in the best interests of your health to have _too_ many of these things lying around at home all at once!

I buy a big tub of these for my dog about every 3-4 months. He loves them. I do mix them in with other treats, so he does not get a steady diet of them. They are given out as the "special" treat, being one notch above a standard, wheat-free dog cookie.

While these are great treats, they are not as "hypnotic" as real meat is. And, given the price, and how inexpensive some good-quality meat is at the grocery store, if you truly want to mesmerize your dog, go with real meat. Its pretty funny that so many of us are paying $7-9 for little bags of dog treats when we could be buying real beef for about $4-5 a pound.

However, most of us don't want slimy hands all day, so we use treats. I use these out when walking my dog, and carry them when we go out backpacking or on long day hikes. I like them because they are feather light, but just don't get them wet or they turn to mush. My dog's interest in them after they get wet goes down a lot.

I do wish the pieces were more uniformly sized, but they aren't too hard to break apart.
Summary: Dogs love them, but pieces aren't sized uniformly and they melt when wet

I tend to favor ordering from vendors that offer Prime shipping since i have the membership but this time i decided to order from PetCo.

I compared the prices from other vendors even though Amazon had lowered their price on this to 36$ compared to 59$ when i first bought them and i was shocked to see PetCo offering these for 6.99$ with 6$ shipping!

So i figured that's a steal for these bones and even though my logic kept saying there must be something wrong with the advertisement i did not want to believe it so silly me went ahead and ordered a bunch only to get upset when i received them and realized a "SUPER bargain" was only an illusion.

I contacted PetCo and they were very polite and helped out right away with the situation so overall even though it was upsetting i didn't find the jackpot of dog bones at least everyone was nice enough to help out and solve this confusion.

Either than that i absolutely LOVE the way Merrick bones make my baby girl so happy and excited every time its time for a new so i will definitely not stop buying them just because of this hick-up.

Lately I've become disenfranchized by the sameness of many of the boxed,powdered drink mixes. Nothing seems to really jump out and make me reach for it eagerly; and a lot of them end up reminiscent of Tang in different flavors.

Lipton's new Tea and Honey Mango Pineapple is a break from the norm. There is a lot of flavor here, and a lot of satisfaction in its qualities. The honey and fruit combines to deliver a refreshing, good-tasting drink that makes me want another right away.

One slight caveat: as with all drinks including artificial sweeteners (sucralose; 5 calories per packet) there is a mild aftertaste. Overall, however, comparing drinks of this sort, this was quite acceptable.
Summary: One point for the powdered drinks

So instead of eating it by itself, I add it to my morning breakfast of greek yogurt, nuts, and coconut oil/flax seed oil.  Now the sweetness is offset by the tartness of the yogurt, and perfectly balanced out.

I really like this product. I NEED coffee in the morning, so I add this to my coffee, in addition to adding a teaspoon of ground espresso to the cup as well. Okay, so most of the kashi items are, in my opinion, hard to compare to other mainstream less healthy options, these however, have almost the exact same texture as the nature valley granola bars. They are definitely crunchy and a bit messy. I actually, for ease of eating purposes, whack my still wrapped/sealed bars against the counter so that the individual pack breaks into smaller/bite size pieces. This makes it easier to eat these, because biting into the bars is a little challenging (yes, they are THAT crunchy!) That being said, the flavor of these bars is quite satisfying and delicious. I find these especially tasty dipped in a bit of honey, almond or peanut butter. I would note however, the extreme crunchiness of these bars may not be conducive to someone who has a hard time chewing, and/or beware, as the grains/seeds have a tendency (not unlike popcorn hulls) to stick in teeth, maybe not great for anyone with dentures/braces. Another important note, Kashi, being wholesome/natural, does not last/have as long of a shelf life as mainstream chemical/sugar laden bars, so when buying these in bulk, be CERTAIN that you will be able to make it through multiple boxes within a fairly short time frame...I think I generally see expiration dates that fall within about 2 to 3 months of purchase on kashi items. All in all though, these are definitely a good overall snack, that you can feel okay about enjoying, and pretty tasty as well.
Summary: These are tasty, but a little tough on teeth!

I don't drink coffee every day, more like once or twice a week, and when I do I prefer a mild cup of coffee. I like good flavor but not too bold, and not bitter. Basically, I would opt for a Dunkin before a Starbucks, just to give you an idea of what I normally drink as I review Marley One Love Coffee.

The box contains 15 single serving pods, individually sealed in foil. Each pod contains about 1/3 of an ounce of coffee. They are very convenient for storage or taking on the road. The cardboard box has a cutout near the bottom to easily dispense the pods (or you can just open the box from the top). The coffee is advertised as "100% Ethiopian Yirgacheffe."

I typically make my coffee in a Keurig or a standard coffee maker/filter. I tried One Love four ways, ONLY ONE OF WHICH IS THE RECOMMENDED USE, as the coffee is advertised as "for use only in single serve home coffee pod brewers". Why did I order this coffee without said pod brewer? When I travel I find more and more hotels have pod brewers, so I am interested in a good coffee to use on the road. Anyway, I made the coffee:

1) In a single serve brewer, a Black and Decker Brew N Go,
2) By filling a Keurig reusable K-Cup/filter.
2) In my standard coffee maker, a Braun, using the pods in the same amount/weight as I would any loose coffee.
3) Steeping a pod in a coffee mug, approximately 7 1/2 ounces in size.

Unlike many coffees, where I think "Wow that smells really good", only to be disappointed by the flavor, Marley One Love hit me just the opposite. When I smelled the unused pod, as well as the brewing coffee, I thought "Hmmm, that doesn't smell too great." But wow, the result is a really nice cup of coffee. One Love is not at all bitter, and I wouldn't even call it bold. It is mild to medium in taste, while not being weak at all. I found I got the best results using it in the Keuring or regular coffee makers. Steeping it was OK, but it was somewhat weaker that way.

I would get this coffee again, either loose in the bag or in pods.
Summary: Nice Cup Of Coffee In A Convenient Pack!

Text:
I received my bag of Kind Healthy Grains clusters free from the Amazon Vine program, in exchange for writing a review.

We eat cereal for breakfast a couple of times per week, and I'm always looking for one the kids like that isn't half sugar and artificial colors. I was really impressed with the ingredients in this product - Non-GMO flax seeds, amaranth, quinoa, oats, millet and buckwheat. No artificial ingredients, preservatives or coloring, and it's sweetened with evaporated cane juice and molasses, and not the dreaded HFCS. It's high in anti-oxidants, Omega-3s, and fiber, and is low in salt and fat. Best of all, it contains actual blueberry puree - very few of the foods sold as "blueberry" actually have any in it!

Overall it's a very good choice for snacking or as cereal. They need to put it in a box or some other container because my bag arrived with all the clusters broken into small pieces. There was no way to eat this except as cereal with milk, or sprinkled on food (we had some on yogurt). It tastes really good, with complex flavors from the various grains. The kids like it, too.
Summary: Healthy and tastes great, but the clusters were crushed

I received this item originally short in qty/weight by 13%. Although I emailed the seller (per Amazon's suggested procedure) they did not contact me after a week so I left a negative review. They did proceed to ship me greater than the short quantity at no-charge to correct the shortage and finally contacted me by both phone and email requesting I remove the original negative review. While I wish they would have contacted me in the first place, I have removed the original review and am replacing it with this one. Although I ended up with more than I ordered, I don't feel it is fair to give a 5 star rating (I feel this is a 3-1/2-star transaction). I firmly believe that had the seller weighed the original shipment accurately and replied to my email in the first place to sort out the shortage I would not have had to leave a negative review originally and would have saved us both a lot of hassle and time. They appear to sell good products, ship quickly and in their message they said they corrected the measurement inaccuracy of their equipment so I am hopeful this was a one-time event.

My Kids, 7 and 8yo's love this product and I do too for all the reasons stated below but I feel I must warn other parents about what happened this past weekend...I know that the product has a warning label that the cap is a choking hazard but I thought that for a 7 and 8yo that may not really not apply...Boy was I wrong...I had to perform the Heimlich on my 8yo who got the cap stuck in her throat...if it weren't the quick action of my 7yo who came running and screaming to me ...things may not have turned out OK.  I just want everyone to be mindful when giving these snacks to their children...even older ones. Please stress to your children to only put food into their mouths. Just as the title of my review says, these Newton Fruit Thins in the Blueberry Brown Sugar flavor taste just like crunchy blueberry muffins. The blueberry flavor is distinct but not overpowering. The brown sugar is subtle; the cookie isn't too sweet (I personally would prefer it sweeter, but my husband and younger son thought it was perfect as is!). The cookie is chewy where the blueberry pieces are, so that's either good or weird depending on your personal inclinations.

These cookies are lower in sugar and fat than many cookies, so they're a healthful alternative to the typical sugar bombs. Should be pleasing to blueberry lovers of all ages! They make for a nice treat. My son has already asked for them in his lunch tomorrow!

Not sure about the price here, though. Seems kinda high and worth doing a local price comparison (just as I did on the Nabisco fudge mint Oreos, which were considerably cheaper locally).
Summary: tastes like a crunchy blueberry muffin

Even the best of teas need some time off,but with this one i am never disappointed.
Two minutes brew time at 175 temp, and it doesn't get bitter,and can make a second great cup minus the caffeine.Remember all the caffeine goes into the first cup.You can avoid the caffeine altogether by giving it a flush for 30 seconds in a cup of 175 degree water and then removing the brewing basket.Thanx

Text: Even as we go onto the 4th box, our dog really likes these treats. They are small so it's easier not to over do it. I especially like "No Artificial Preservatives. No Added Salt. No Added Sugar."

This coffee has a really strong roasted/burnt flavor to it. If you like typical non-gourmet morning coffee then you will like this; however, I have traveled down south, to countries like Mexico, Brazil, Argentina, Columbia, etc. and have tasted fresh roasted REAL coffee direct from the trees at the farm the very next day after a harvest. I prefer my coffee black, as-is, in other words I like to drink and taste my coffee rather than pour in a bunch of other crazy flavors.

Real coffee roasted properly is fairly smooth anyway, with a strong taste of coffee bean and a hint of smoke, it is very pleasing. This coffee is more like bitter burnt charcoal, but here in the USA we tend to drink coffee to stay awake so this coffee does have it's purpose, the burnt bitter taste slapped my eyes wide-open from the very first sip so I stay lively at work with a spring in my step all day, but not to any extreme, for example, 4 cups in 10 minutes didn't give me the caffeine jitters. I'll have to look for something a little smoother to drink at home though or I'll never want to sleep at night.

If you like green bean fresh roasted, gourmet, or exotic coffees stay away, this is not for you. If you like to fill your glass with milk and sugar, then give this a try, you'll have to pour in twice as much flavor filled fat and sugar to cover up the powerful taste of this stuff. If you sip coffee at work to stay awake this is a excellent choice because it is at least 2 times stronger than Folder's or Maxwell's dark roasts.

Its just dark enough for my tastes to be brewed on the 7.25oz setting. It has a dark chocolate and brandy aroma. The house blend has a boldness falling in between a medium brew (gloria jeans hazlenut) and a lighter bold brew (newmans organic). The taste is pleasant and has notes of cocoa and malt, and an aftertaste of walnuts. I would recommend this as a keep around the house brew, but not for something to impress guests.
Found the tea flavor very clean and smooth.  Love the tea bag.

I have used this 6 to 7 times so far and the dandruff control is very good. The conditioner is good but the smell of the shampoo is a bit strong for my taste. To my surprise I did not get that tingling feeling after using say "Selsum Blue" or "Head and Shoulders". Thus I did not get that clean refreshing feeling of having had a good shampoo. Nevertheless the product lives up to its claims quite well.

The item did leak quite a bit in transit as some other reviewers have stated. But that does not reflect upon the quality of the product just the shipping department so I just ignored that in my rating. What would make this a 5 star product? For me that would be a less pronounced smell and a tingling feeling while shampooing.
Comment |
Looking for voting buttons? Sorry, we don't let customers vote on their own reviews.
Summary: Very good dandruff control. Good conditioner.  The aroma is a tad loud.

Text: I mix it in smoothies and ice cream and have it every morning. In ice cream, I can't taste it at all. It does need some masking, not the best flavor, but grape juice and bananas work well, berries too. Feel very regular since I started using it. The price was great and it will last a long time, since I've followed the freezing/refrigeration instructions. I figure I can't go wrong with this fiber and protein source. It encourages me to eat more fruit, and I'm starting to blend in a few veggies too and you can't get enough of those! I even found recipes online for baking with this stuff and made oatmeal cookies that actually turned out good! I recommend it to anyone who wants more fiber in their diet and likes experimenting with new recipes for baking and blending drinks.

These seem to be a good alternative to Greenies that my dog loves. As far as cleaning the teeth I haven't noticed a difference but it definitely helps with my doggie's breath. This one doesn't contain wheat for those dogs allergic to that like mine. Greenies have wheat in them

See's Candies is a well-known San Francisco chocolate company, now with stores throughout the United States. In California, the lines to buy chocolate can snake out the door. I've had See's Candies many times, most recently this assortment, and while See's makes an excellent product, the chocolate coating could be richer in flavor. Still, these confections are above average; they easily outclass ordinary brands such as Russell Stover and Whitman's with fresher and more flavorful fillings.

Anyone receiving a box of See's Candies for a gift knows that an extra effort has been made. Although they aren't the best I've had, they certainly rank up there with the finest chocolate assortments available in a box.
Have found no fault in this product. Material is good and heavy enough that gives a sense of value for money. Can go for it

Really nice whisky, sweet malt, floral citrus, salt, honey character (only an Orkney malt can taste like this), velvety smooth mouth feel, wonderful oily, if too short, a finish.  Excellent with high quality cheeses and Italian meats before dinner.
the ingredient list in earth's best trumps some conventional formulas for just slightly more. both my son and I am pleased with this product.

My baby is 7 months old and she LOVES these!  They are easy for her to hold, dissolve almost instantly, have few ingredients, low calories, and make a great easy snack for home or on the go.  I couldn't find veggie flavored in the store, only the original flavor.  Buying these on subscribe and save makes them cheaper than in the store anyway, so, yay!  I took off one star because these turn into paste when wet, so they stick everywhere.  You will need a wet cloth nearby to clean up your baby and likely the area they are eating in.  I don't know of any baby so far that doesn't like these.  When my daughter goes through one pack she goes crazy for seconds.

I bought Kitty's Garden after I first discovered my cat trying to nibble on all the fake plants in my home. I had to spray those with bitter apple just to get him to stop. I was a bit skeptical about buying the pre-grown pots of grass from the pet store, because I bought those in the past for my gerbils and they wilted quickly after purchase. I do not have a "green thumb" in any way, shape or form (hence all the fake plants in my place), but decided to buy this one because it boasted a nice variety of organic grasses for my spoiled cat and the wood container was adorable.

I found this kit very easy to use. So easy, in fact, that I started my garden in my office and left it on the window ledge there for the first week. Of the four grains offered, I found that the barley one didn't thrive in my kit. A bit of sparse grass grew from that compartment, but overall barley was a disappointment. However, I still highly recommend this kit to any other pet owner that needs some grass for their four-legged "pet-kid".
Summary: Very easy to grow, my cat enjoys nibbling on it

Text:
I LOVE cooking with new flavors, and pride myself on being an adventurous cook. I don't do beef much (a few times a year), but happened to have some primo beef that was perfect for this.

I seared my beef in a cast iron skillet on all sides, then cooked partway through.

I mixed the coconut powder, water, and oil in a Pyrex measuring cup, and added it to the pan, then added the paste. It blended together perfectly! No lumps or issues. *BUT, I am not a fan of the dehydrated vegetable pieces--those were a distraction and we picked them out in the end.*

I cooked the meat through with the lid on, at a med-low heat, stirring every few minutes, and turning the beef.

To go with it, I made a mixture of different colors of quinoa and a side of lightly sauteed asparagus with garlic.

The beef took on the color of the sauce (all the way through the meat). I found this interesting.

The flavor, I thought, was VERY good, especially with the quinoa. I actually could have just eaten it with the vegetables and quinoa, and opted out of the beef altogether. My guest, on the other hand, found it spicy (hot-spicy) and although he liked the flavor of the dish, said he would not order it for himself due to how his particular tastebuds perceived that hot-ness. My mother and her husband would have found it altogether inedible, because they cannot handle any "spice" in their foods. Just an FYI, in case you have sensitive people to feed.

It made a LOT of food. We two adults ate about 1/3 of the dish.

I personally would order this for me, but since he can't enjoy it, it puts a damper on my recommendation. I hate making a dinner that ends up too spicy for my guest(s). I know that I have a system that loves spicy foods, so I tend to overlook this part of creating a menu. It's not like you can opt out of that sauce with this dinner. ;)
I guess I'll just order similar dishes for myself when we go out to eat ;)
Summary: Hot?  Not for me, but for my guest it was...

I've had four or five of these cans, and the olives are consistently decent, but not great.  They're appropriate for the price, and very pleasant.  The last can I received was a mess, though.  There were no herbs whatsoever, and every single olive was inferior, be it discolored, mushy, or with borer holes.  I think they accidentally packaged the rejected olives.  Major bummer, but how the heck did that make it past quality control?

I was never all that fond of vinegar in my food or otherwise, but recently I was told that raw vinegar is a good health/dieatary supplement.  I have been taking it by mixing two tablespoons of vinegar with two tablespoons of honey or molasses, one teaspoon of spirulina with about 8 ounces of water.  In drinking the mixture with honey, it still has a mild pungent quality but is not hard to swallow like vinegar alone.  When using molasses with the mixture, virtually all of the pungent quality is taken away, but it's not nearly as sweet as the mixture with honey.  Although the honey is better tasting, I opt for the mixture with molasses since it's healthier.
Nice Product

The taste is perfect. Smoky with just enough heat to let you know it is there. These don't have 5 alarm heat if that's what you are looking for. These almonds are perfectly seasoned and very addicting. Great if you are on a ketogenic or low carb diet.

What I like about this is I get a healthier option for soda without the bad aftertaste of diet soda. The only reason I gave this 4 stars is because nothing will ever beat regular Coca-Cola when it comes to cola flavored soda. But I don't like all the sugar that's in Coke.
The only downside right now is the price. You are paying roughly $1.13 a can, but if you don't guzzle the stuff then it won't matter. I do plan to buy some of the other flavors.

Price per K-cups get poor marks when assessing for "value"; however, in terms of quality there is an earthiness and flavor profile that far exceeds any regular drip brew that I have experienced for home brewers (with an obvious exception for french press coffee).  What I sacrifice in terms of increased per K-Cup cost is made up for in terms of quality.  I enjoy Starbucks, regardless of their corporate profile.  Going to Starbucks is likely to result in a $4-5 dollar cup of coffee; where as I sit here now and for just about a buck I am enjoying a natural, black cup of Medium Roast Starbies... Loving it...

I have bought a few of the Gloria Jean's coffees and really enjoy this one.  The flavor is there, but not overbearing and the taste is smooth.  I would recommend this to anyone that likes flavored coffees.

I've tried 2 types of FoodShouldTasteGood chips - the Multigrain and these. I must say, I'm impressed with both. Most snack foods go out of their way to hit you over the head with their flavors. Not so here. The tastes are subtle and interesting. Gourmet snacks, if you like.

In character and consistency, I think the best way way to describe these is to say that they are mid way between a regular corn Tortilla chip and a Wheat Thins cracker (though there is, in fact, no wheat in the ingredients). Lightly salted with just a hint of Olive and Garlic. Very tasty and very snack-able.

The one-ounce bags, though they may at first glance seem packaging intensive, are a good idea. If you had a big bag of these in front of you, it would take significant will power to stop after just one ounce. The small bags are a crutch for those of us who lack self-control.

Another plus: the bag proclaims in bold type, "No Trans Fat, No Cholesterol, No Preservatives, No GMO (Genetically Modified Organism) Ingredients, No Artificial Colors and No Artificial Flavors". 10% of your daily fiber and just 3% of your sodium too! I had them with a cold beer and felt like I was eating an oxymoron.

These are a delicious but natural snack. Well worth the 140 calories they cost. But a few words must be devoted to their monetary price. For about 18 bucks you'll get 24 ounces of these - about 75 cents per ounce. Last week, I bought a 17.5 ounce bag of Ruffles for $3.49 - about 20 cents per ounce. That's quite a differential. Whether you're willing to shell out the extra cash for a non-essential snack will depend on your tastes, your priorities and your pocketbook.
Product is good.heat so fast .but wire is very short
